body: :-1:. You were told why supporting multiple languages at TFD is a bad idea.

First, this Pr adds no language support, it only allows us to specify filenames instead of numbers.
Yes we also can now install german versions but it was already able with old RA1 Cds or Tiberian Sun CDs. Also German RA2 CDs can be used... can be used since RA2 has installation support.

To avoid localization Problems we have to drop complete CD installations :(

Looks reasonable. Will test tomorrow.

On 2015-08-16, at 6:15 PM, "Guido L." notifications@github.com wrote:

> This Pr adds more flexibilty to the TFD Installer when installing content from TFD discs. by using index lookup.

updated
updated also added the missing speech02.mix
has dependencies
On what?

updated

tested with english and german disks
dependencies was related to RA2 but are now solved

OK let's make the purpose of this PR clear, because "Improve TFD Installation logic" and "adds more flxibility" aren't.

This should replace the file IDs in YAML with file names.
This should **_not**_ add support for non-english disks.
This should **_not**_ try to add support for RA2, if that includes any hacks in the code.

Am I missing anything?
@penev92: Except that it does _exactly_ what you listed, nothing.
closing for now because of missunderstanding what this PR does This Pr should only improve the installation logic of the TFD installation. not adding german support.
Well OK, since we discussed it on IRC last night and figured out the misunderstanding I don't know why you'd close it before someone tested it, but OK.

@pchote as dicussed in IRC

```
<penev> we keep the ID lookup by name (which is nice); we add a check if this is an english DVD; if not, we issue a warning along the lines of "non-english versions of TFD are not supported. Install at your own risk!"
<GraionDilach> that's acceptable
```
- We remove the RA2 compatiblity.
- We put a warning when using non english DVDs "non english DVDs may not fully compatible, install at your own risk!"

is that OK?
updated
I can't find where it throws the warning. That change is still requested.
That notice should be in the changelog

No. We were over this on IRC. A warning in the changelog makes no difference.
In case @pchote and @Mailaender are OK with the suggestion, it can go in the game. Otherwise we can't take this PR, as discussed on IRC yesterday.
yes then we need message box support in OpenRA =(
You can add a label to the content copy process dialog where you can write the warning message in capslock.

http://www.schnittberichte.com/schnittbericht.php?ID=3406

The following is different between english and german DVDs
Red Alert 1
- 13 replaced movies (kill scenes, briefing and missions)
- OIL and Cyborgs

tiberian sun 
- replaced movies (5 movies are blacked out where in the english version is blood)
- OIL and Cyborgs
- Name of the Game is changed

generals & Zero Hour is drastical censored.
- Factions
- Units and buildings are renamed
- missions (all the last ones) are cutted and has no ingame scenes
- movies are replaced by in-mission scenes (camaera moving)
- Teasers in german are not available
- 2 missions are changed and replaced
updated

I don't get your obsessions with warnings about non-existing incompatibilities. Those assets are binary compatible. Even the Generals censorship could be undone with content patches only. Localisation is often done after the game has gone gold by non-technical people or it is outsourced completely. That is the reason we don't get into trouble here.

This unhardcodes ugly file offsets to make this work with any TFD disc. :+1: It makes the whole thing much more robust and sane. Can't test as I don't own the DVD myself.

Binary compatible in Westwood terms means that the executable, art.ini, rules.ini, sound.ini and the map is the same. Everything else can differ.

The problem is that OpenRA does not react to the same for missing assets as the Westwood games. If an asset lost a frame, got removed because being unused, then the WW games will deal with it, but OpenRA throws a crash.

I still haven't seen any of you actually checking out to see if each file still exists within the localized mixes and that's just the German version. There might be more versions as well.

Please stop spreading FUD. We have never received a crash report so far when someone used localized mix files even though there are many and even fan made ones out on the net. The worst thing that could happen here is weird translations in icons and terrible voice actors.

Changelog could be something like:

```
The "The First Decade" Installation Logic has been improved.
```

> yes then we need message box support in OpenRA =(

We already have `ConfirmationDialogs.PromptConfirmAction`.
and depends label please because the asset code is moving....

Doesn't look like there will be any conflicts between the two PRs other than that moving `ContentInstaller` to a new file and this one changing 2 lines in it, which is a very simple rebase regardless of which one gets merged first.
Otherwise we can move this together with your PR
